data.name: PropertyAttribute
desc: These values are used to specify the behavior of a Property.

items.name: MAYBEVOID
lines: indicates that a property value can be void.
It does not mean that the type of the property is void!

items.name: BOUND
lines: indicates that a PropertyChangeEvent will be fired to all registered XPropertyChangeListeners whenever the value of this property changes.

items.name: CONSTRAINED
lines: indicates that a PropertyChangeEvent will be fired to all registered XVetoableChangeListeners whenever the value of this property is about to change.

items.name: TRANSIENT
lines: indicates that the value of the property is not persistent.

items.name: READONLY
lines: indicates that the value of the property is read-only.

items.name: MAYBEAMBIGUOUS
lines: indicates that the value of the property can be ambiguous.

items.name: MAYBEDEFAULT
lines: indicates that the property can be set to default.

items.name: REMOVABLE
lines: indicates that the property can be removed (i.e., by calling XPropertyContainer.removeProperty()).

items.name: OPTIONAL
lines: indicates that a property is optional.
This attribute is not of interest for concrete property implementations. It's needed for property specifications inside service specifications in UNOIDL.
